burlap-shirt.description: While its resistances are far from fantastic, this cheap mess of cloth may give a player the edge they need as they struggle to establish themselves.

burlap-shoes.name: Jute skoene
burlap-shoes.description: Burlap shoes are a peice of clothing that goes on the feet, Burlap shoes also are the quietest, making footsteps harder to hear. This could provide an advantage to close range fighting when it comes to flanking or ambushing.

burlap-trousers.name: Goiingbroek
burlap-trousers.description: About as basic as it gets. Burlap Trousers offer meager protection across the board at a cheap price, yet remains better at cold resistance than some of its perceived 'superiors' such as the Hide Pants.

candle-hat.name: Kershoed
candle-hat.description: The candle hat may not have the best protection by itself, but it can be used in conjunction with the bandana to great effect. That said, it should be turned off when fighting in the dark so as to not give your opponent a visibility advantage. It commonly finds brief usage when a player desires to expand their base or mine under the cover of night.

chicken-costume.name: Hoender Kostuum
chicken-costume.description: An inflatable chicken costume. Acting as a replacement for wooden pants, you can equip this item to look as silly as possible.

clatter-helmet.name: Clatter Helm
clatter-helmet.description:
A special item for those who own Clatter.

To have it, it is necessary to buy from other games and play for 30 minutes.

coffee-can-helmet.name: Koffie Blik Helm
coffee-can-helmet.description: The coffee can helmet is a face protector that is one tier below the metal facemask, it offers good protection against physical damage to the head and costs less to craft than its older and better brother, the metal facemask.

crate-costume.description: A sneaky crate costume. Use with a friend to expertly troll other players

diving-fins.description: The diving fins are flippers that make you walk slow on land and swim a lot faster. They have no protection stats so only use them for swimming.

diving-mask.description: A Diving Mask. Provides clear vision under water.

diving-tank.description: The Diving Tank is a tank of air used for staying underwater for extended periods of time, 10 minutes to be exact. After this is up, you will need to refill it at a workbench. This item must be worn to work, and occupies the top torso layer (usually where chest armor goes). Note that wearing the tank while not underwater will not deplete the oxygen supply.

double-horse-saddle.description: A horse saddle with two seats. Having this item allows you to claim a horse in a stable by holding E and selecting the 'Claim' option

dracula-cape.name: Dracula Cape
dracula-cape.description: A robustly thick outer garment providing ample protection to the wearer.

dracula-mask.description: A classic halloween costume mask which provides decent protection.

dragon-mask.description: A special dragon mask to celebrate Chinese New Year.

egg-suit.name: Eierpak
egg-suit.description: An eggsquisite egg costume, can be painted when unequipped.

frankenstein-mask.description: Frankenstein halloween costume mask which provides decent protection.

frog-boots.name: Kikker Stewels
frog-boots.description: Added for anyone who owned the game while it was in Early Access. Provides more rad protection than other early game clothes, making it slightly OP.

ghost-costume.name: Spookkostuum
ghost-costume.description: Definitely not a last minute costume idea.

gingerbread-suit.description: A suit made of gingerbread, slightly crunchy.

glowing-eyes.name: Gloeiende oë
glowing-eyes.description: Lighting effect used for the Halloween 2017 Murderer NPCs.

hazmat-suit.name: Hazmat pak
hazmat-suit.description:
The Hazmat Suit allows the wearer to travel through rad-towns and other irradiated areas safely. While it doesn't provide full protection in certain places at monuments, such as the main building at Launch Site, or the cooling tower at the Nuclear Power Plant, it offers protection from radiation poisoning at almost every other monument on the map, making it useful for exploring.

The suit itself is a bright yellow color, meaning it is easy to spot from a distance.

headset.name: Koptelefoon
headset.description: Every gamer needs a headset! - Gained from Rust's first Twitch drop event.

heavy-frankenstein-head.name: Swaar Frankenstein-kop
heavy-frankenstein-head.description:
Slightly slower, slightly stronger.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

heavy-frankenstein-legs.name: Swaar Frankenstein-bene
heavy-frankenstein-legs.description:
Slightly slower, slightly stronger.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

heavy-frankenstein-torso.name: Swaar Frankenstein-bolyf
heavy-frankenstein-torso.description:
Slightly slower, slightly stronger.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

heavy-plate-helmet.name: Swaar plaathelm
heavy-plate-helmet.description:
A high-tier protective helmet which protects the entire head. It costs High Quality Metal and Sheet Metal making it fairly easy to acquire near monuments and dungeons.

The Heavy Plate Helmet will cause a user's view to be diminished to a small rectangle.

Due to heavy plate armour suffering from increased fire damage, it can be countered by a flamethrower or incendiary ammo.

heavy-plate-jacket.name: Swaar plaathelm
heavy-plate-jacket.description:
A high-tier protective item that will protect the user from a large portion of the damage dealt by most sources at the price of a movement penalty. It will also amplify the effects of cold and heat damage on the player, making it a situational item.

This item also disables the ability to aim down sights on weapons.

heavy-plate-pants.name: Swaar plaathelm
heavy-plate-pants.description: An high-tier protective item that will protect the user from a large portion of the damage dealt by most sources at the price of a movement penalty. It will also amplify the effects of cold and heat damage on the player, making it a situational item.

heavy-scientist-suit.name: 'N Swaar gevaarpak wat van bestralingsbestande rubber gemaak is.
heavy-scientist-suit.description: A Heavy Scientist Suit worn by the heavy scientists which are spawned at the oil rigs. Unobtainable during normal gameplay, it can only be acquired through console by admins.

hide-boots.name: Leer Stewels
hide-boots.description: The Hide Boots fall smack in the middle-tier of footwear, offering superiority only in defense against animal attacks. They are still quite cheap, however, so it might be worth it to upgrade from the Burlap Shoes.

hide-halterneck.description: Statistically identical to the burlap shirt in spite of its provocative display of the skin.

hide-pants.name: Leerbroek
hide-pants.description: Superior bite resistance and inferior cold resistance is all that divides the hide pants from the burlap trousers. The limited availability of leather prompts most players to save it for boots, gloves, or higher-end armor.

hide-poncho.name: Leer Poncho
hide-poncho.description: With lower resistances than any other item that takes up a torso armor slot, the Hide Poncho's only real advantage is the warmth it provides. Good for those living in tundra and mountain areas, or perhaps for a new player that happens to have a lot of extra leather.

hide-skirt.name: Leer romp
hide-skirt.description: Statistically equivalent to burlap trousers. Doesn't mesh very well with most torso attire.

hide-vest.name: Leer Frokkie
hide-vest.description: While the hide vest is superior to the burlap shirt at deflecting animal attacks, the difference is hardly significant enough to entice players into prioritizing it.

high-quality-horse-shoes.description: Equipping these horse shoes will grant your horse additional movement speed

hoodie.name: Kappie
hoodie.description: The hoodie offers the greatest projectile and melee resistance out of all the under armor variants. This superiority is offset by its high research and production cost.

horse-saddle.description: Having this item allows you to claim a horse in a stable by holding E and selecting the 'Claim' option

hot-air-balloon-armor.description: Armor for the Hot Air Balloon

improvised-balaclava.name: Geïmproviseerde Balaclava
improvised-balaclava.description: Essentially acting as an upgrade to the burlap headwrap, the balaclava's most distinguished aspect is its ability to resist cold. Because it is bound to containers and lacks stats significant enough to warrant researching, the balaclava is not often seen.

jacket.name: Baadjie
jacket.description: Though not as widely employed as its wooden counterpart, the jacket bridges the gap dividing the aforementioned and road sign. It offers superior projectile resistance to its predecessors, and founds the melee resistance that will remain static up through to the metal chest plate.

large-backpack.description: A large, military issued backpack that lets you carry 28 extra items.

leather-gloves.description:
The minuscule damage reduction of the leather gloves is off-set by the tendency for the player to be shot in the chest rather than the legs, as well as the reduced cost in comparison to the boots.

As was described, the protection of the gloves extend to the rest of the chest as well.

light-frankenstein-head.name: Ligte Frankenstein-kop
light-frankenstein-head.description:
Slightly faster, slightly weaker.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

light-frankenstein-legs.name: Ligte Frankenstein-bene
light-frankenstein-legs.description:
Slightly faster, slightly weaker.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

light-frankenstein-torso.name: Ligte Frankenstein-bolyf
light-frankenstein-torso.description:
Slightly faster, slightly weaker.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

longsleeve-t-shirt.name: T-hemp met lang moue
longsleeve-t-shirt.description: Common torso attire sharing the same stats as the t-shirt. Default skin is very noticeable.

medium-frankenstein-head.name: Middelmatige Frankenstein-Hoof
medium-frankenstein-head.description:
A balanced head.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

medium-frankenstein-legs.name: Medium Frankenstein-bene
medium-frankenstein-legs.description:
A balanced set of legs.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

medium-frankenstein-torso.name: Medium Frankenstein-bolyf
medium-frankenstein-torso.description:
A balanced torso.

Combined at a Frankenstein Table to create your very own monster.

metal-chest-plate.name: Metaal Borsplaat
metal-chest-plate.description: The metal chest plate is a versatile end-game armor used most often when roaming and raiding. Though high quality metal is often stored in abundance due to its limited use, players should begin making room for the sewing kits as this period comes into the horizon.

metal-facemask.name: Metaal masker
metal-facemask.description: A high-tier protective face mask which somehow protects the entire head. It costs High Quality Metal, making it quite expensive compared to its alternatives, but in return offers the greatest protection to almost all forms of physical damage in exchange for decreasing cold protection.

miners-hat.name: Myners Hoed
miners-hat.description: The miner's hat is capable of doing all that the candle hat can, but with greater resistances to boot. It is, however, much easier to gauge where a player is looking if their light is on.

mummy-mask.description: A classic halloween costume mask which provides decent protection.

nvgm-scientist-suit.description: A hazmat suit made from radiation resistant rubber.

nest-hat.description: An extremely silly easter nest hat with googly eyes.

night-vision-goggles.name: Nagvisie-bril
night-vision-goggles.description: Enables vision at nighttime by projecting and amplifying infrared light.The batteries can be recharged at a Lvl 2 workbench. Cannot be worn with a helmet.

ox-mask.description: An Ox mask to celebrate the 2021 Lunar New Year.

pants.name: Broek
pants.description: As the best available clothing for the legs the pants are a must-research.

parachute.description: Once equipped, press [+jump] while in mid-air to pull the cord. Must be repacked after use. Must be at least 15m above the ground in order to deploy.

party-hat.name: Partytjie hoed
party-hat.description: A very stupid looking party hat.

prisoner-hood.description: A hood for prisoners, restricts vision.

purple-sunglasses.description: Sunglasses - Gained from Rust's first Twitch drop event.

rabbit-mask.description: A Beautifully crafted Rabbit mask to celebrate the 2023 Lunar New Year

rat-mask.description: A Beautifully crafted bronze and gold Rat mask to celebrate the 2020 Lunar New Year

reindeer-antlers.name: Rendier Antlers
reindeer-antlers.description: The Reindeer Antlers are festive headgear that can be found in small presents. Its comparable to wearing Burlap Headwrap.

riot-helmet.name: Oproerhelmet
riot-helmet.description: A mid-tier helmet that protects the user's head. Made without the need for High-Quality-Metal, the helmet is an inexpensive form of protection that offers exceptional melee resistance and amicable projectile resistance. It comes in a rather form-fitting default black skin, which tends to camouflage rather well, with several other user skins in the same vein.

road-sign-jacket.name: Padteken Baadjie
road-sign-jacket.description: The road sign jacket has become the staple of mid-game armor due primarily to its worthwhile projectile resistance without necessitating high quality metal.

road-sign-kilt.name: Padteken-plooi
road-sign-kilt.description: The lack of a metal chest plate or jacket equivalent to leg armor allows the road sign kilt a monopoly on both mid and end-game leg armor. Heavy plate pants are all that can surpass it statistically, but those are seldom seen outside of airlock brawls due to their movement penalty.

roadsign-gloves.name: Roadsign-handskoene
roadsign-gloves.description: Gloves made out of metal offers a good amount of protection to the upper body.

roadsign-horse-armor.description: A set of roadsign armor for a horse

saddle-bag.description: Equipping this saddle bag will add extra storage space on your horse

santa-beard.description: A santa beard. Ho Ho ho.

santa-hat.name: Vader Kersfees hoed
santa-hat.description: A santa hat that can be found in christmas presents during the end of the year.

scarecrow-suit.description: An item that can only be spawned in the console menu by admins. Currently the icon appears to be a wetsuit but when it is on a character it will be the scarecrow NPC costume from the Halloween event.

scientist-suit.description: A piece of clothing worn by the Scientist NPCs. Although it is an unobtainable item, it can be spawned in by an admin.

shirt.name: Hemp
shirt.description: Container equivalent of hide vest. Meshes poorly with most leg attire. Default skin camouflages well at night.

shorts.name: Kortbroek
shorts.description: With identical stats to the burlap trousers and hide skirt in spite of its increased cloth cost, crafting the shorts is a choice of aesthetic over function.

single-horse-saddle.description: A horse saddle with one seat. Having this item allows you to claim a horse in a stable by holding E and selecting the 'Claim' option

small-backpack.description: A small, makeshift backpack that lets you carry 12 extra items.

snow-jacket.name: Sneeu Kamo-Baadjie
snow-jacket.description: An article of clothing that takes up the chest slot for both clothes and armor. It is recommended for anyone who lives in the snow, though not being able to wear armor is very detrimental.

snowman-helmet.name: Sneeuman helm
snowman-helmet.description: A snowman helmet which provides ample protection.

sunglasses.description: A pair of sunglasses. Functional and stylish!

surgeon-scrubs.description:
This surgeon suit is craftable if you own the item on Steam, and, in terms of ballistic protection, makes a great alternative for the Hazmat Suit due to not requiring a researched blueprint, and having a decent, mid-tier overall body protection in one piece, rather than separate pieces of clothing to cover all areas, for a relatively cheap crafting cost.

It has no real specialisation, other than a decent radiation protection (which still doesn't compete with the hazmat suit) that allows you to go in most places. Therefore, it's really just the fact it's a cool-looking surgeon suit, and offers fair overall protection.

For combat purposes, the Surgeon Scrubs positions itself in the mid-tier segment, directly next to armaments such as the Bone Armor kit, Hazmat Suit, and commonly put together clothes sets that lack any specialized pieces of armor.

t-shirt.name: T-hemp
t-shirt.description: Same resistances as longsleeve t-shirt while being nowhere near as common.

tactical-gloves.name: Taktiese handskoene
tactical-gloves.description: Military issue tactical gloves provide protection as well as weapon stabilization leading to higher accuracy when used.

tank-top.name: Tank Top
tank-top.description: The tank top offers inferior resistances at equivalent production cost when compared to the hide vest. Its only redeeming quality is that it can be found in crates, but its drop chance is pathetic even in that regard. If that wasn't enough, the burlap shirt also triumphs over this advanced piece of role player technology. If you do manage to come across one and are possessed into wanting to manufacture more, be prepared to cough up 75 scrap.

tiger-mask.description: A special tiger mask to celebrate Chinese New Year

twitch-rivals-flag.description: A wearable flag for Twitch Rivals

waterwell-npc-jumpsuit.description: A green jumpsuit and gasmask worn by the waterwell NPC

wetsuit.description:
The Wetsuit is used for staying dry while swimming in water.

If a player is wearing a wetsuit, they will never get the 'WET' effect.
It is especially helpful for swimming in colder regions as it takes much longer to dry in the cold.
It also has a huge 15% radiation resistance which can be useful for new players in radtowns.

wolf-headdress.name: Wolf Hoofbedekking
wolf-headdress.description:
Scavenging the wolf skull necessary to produce this headdress won't be easy, but it pays for itself and then some with the resistances it grants; phenomenal melee and explosive protection, excellent projectile defense, and a pleasant resistance to cold makes this thing a primitive powerhouse.

If that weren't enough, its ability to combine with the bandana can push it even further beyond its already unbelievable state. Treasure these.

wood-armor-helmet.name: Houtpantserhelm
wood-armor-helmet.description: Though not significant, the wood armor helmet differentiates itself from its cloth counterparts with its superior melee resistance.

wood-armor-pants.name: Hout-gepantserde Broek
wood-armor-pants.description: The wood armor pants are a cheap, effective source of leg protection, uncontested in their role until the road sign kilt makes itself available. Though its projectile resistance is meager, it prospers in the early game as a melee meat shield.

wood-chestplate.name: Hout-borsplaat
wood-chestplate.description: Though the component cost may delay its acquisition by fresh players, those fortunate enough to utilize this armor will be satisfied by its ability to shrug off melee attacks.

wooden-horse-armor.description: A set of wooden horse armor

binoculars.description: Binoculars are a cost-efficient way to spy on your unaware neighbors, or get a clear view of the surrounding land. They provide three levels of magnification (changed with the left mouse button), including one level far stronger than the zoom of a 4x scope. Cheap, easy to use, and can be a lifesaver when used by a smart and careful player.

birthday-cake.name: Verjaardagkoek
birthday-cake.description: A very special and happy birthday to rust!

camera.name: Kamera
camera.description: A camera. Take screenshots with primary fire, zoom in and out with secondary fire, and lock focus with third fire.

chainsaw.description:
The Chainsaw is a somewhat rare harvesting tool which is an upgrade to the Hatchet and Salvaged Axe. It requires fuel to use, holding up to 50 at once, and must be revved up before it can be used. The chainsaw quickly cuts through trees, even if it doesn't hit the weak spot, and is very useful for gathering large amounts of wood quickly.

The chainsaw can also be used as a melee weapon or for cutting through constructions, but beware that it loses durability very fast when doing these tasks.

fishing-tackle.description:
The Fishing Tackle is a quest item, it is found inside the fisherman's toolbox near the coast of the Fishing Village, it appears when you start the quest.

It currently has no use in game.

flare.name: 'n Ligstok
flare.description:
Flare can be thrown on the ground to emit red light with large radius. Can be useful in darker areas. However, this can bring enemies to you as the red light is visible from far away.

Can be recycled for gunpowder.

flashlight.description: A powerful flashlight which illuminates your surroundings and can be used as a weapon.

garry's-mod-tool-gun.description:
Garry's Mod Tool Gun is a special tool that has the same functions as the Hammer, with slightly increased range and repairs faster.

It can be obtained by buying Garry's Mod on your current Steam account and play for at least 30 minutes.

geiger-counter.description:
The Geiger Counter is a prop used by the Scientist NPC for scanning radiation.

This item cannot be obtained by player and can only be spawned by the admin.
The first person model shows the player holding a medical syringe and it has no function whatsoever.

hammer.name: Нamer
hammer.description: A tool used for rotating, repairing, and upgrading parts of structures. It can also be used to pick up certain deployable items.

handmade-fishing-rod.description:
Handmade Fishing Rod is a tool used to catch fishes as well as junks that might come in handy.

To use the Handmade Fishing Rod, hold RMB and cast out with LMB. Once you've got a bait ready to go simply aim at the water while holding RMB and cast out with LMB. Once you've got a bite, you'll need to reel in the fish. You can use A/D to pull left and right and S to reel the fish in.

hatchet.name: Byl
hatchet.description: This tool is a must-have for any Rust player. It is the most efficient tool when gathering wood and harvesting animals. Relatively cheap and durable, this tool should be what you aim for in the early stages of the game.

instant-camera.name: Onmiddellike kamera
instant-camera.description: An instant camera. Take photos with primary fire, zoom in and out with secondary fire, and change focus mode with reload. Photographs can be viewed by clicking on them in your inventory. Photographs can also be put into picture frames.

jackhammer.description: Along with The Team System Update, the Jackhammer was the competitor, tool wise, to the chainsaw. It can be found in tool crates or sunken crates. It does not need fuel, and can be repaired at a repair bench or replenished at a workbench for no cost.

metal-detector.description: Detects metal objects which may otherwise be hidden. When the light flashes, or you hear a beep, aim to search for items. Increase the bar until a flag appears. Dig at the flag with a melee item to reveal what it is. Different areas yield different rewards. The metal detector does not work on safezones.

pickaxe.name: Pickaxe
pickaxe.description: An improved gathering rate is offset by a significantly longer gather speed, though it is nonetheless considered far superior to its stone counterpart. It is as efficient as the salvaged ice pick but just a bit slower.

rf-transmitter.name: RF-sender
rf-transmitter.description: A hand held RF signal broadcaster. If transmit signal matches with RF Receiver, the Output of RF Receiver starts flowing power if broadcasted.

rock.name: Klip
rock.description:
The Rock is practically the mascot of Rust. As both a weapon and tool, every player starting with one must use it to initially collect resources and protect themselves from the environment before upgrading to superior utensils. The Rock, if broken, is very cheap to craft, costing only a few stones.

It is unarguably the least efficient tool and weapon in the game. With its low gather rates and slow speed, most players will desire to immediately upgrade to at least stone tools once they have acquired enough resources.

salvaged-axe.name: Herwinde Byl
salvaged-axe.description: The Salvaged Axe is the upgraded version of the hatchet. It collects more wood and breaks down the trees faster. It has a slower swing speed than the hatchet so some people prefer the hatchet over it.

salvaged-hammer.name: Herwinde Hamer
salvaged-hammer.description:
Essentially an upgraded rock, the Salvaged Hammer is capable of gathering just about anything, but is not as good as an axe or pickaxe for gathering their respective resources.
The Salvaged Hammer is the best tool for quickly melee raiding the sheet metal door, taking only 28 minutes, 10 seconds and 24 salvaged hammers.

salvaged-icepick.name: Herwinde Yspik
salvaged-icepick.description: The Salvaged Icepick distinguished itself from the pick line due to its superior gather speed at the cost of valuable components.

satchel-charge.name: Plofbare tas
satchel-charge.description:
The Satchel Charge is a midgame raiding tool that can be used to destroy player-made buildings for the purpose of entering and looting another player's base.

The Satchel charge becomes armed when placed, has a random time until detonation, and has a small chance to malfunction, requiring the user to pick up and rearm the Charge. Note that sometimes the charge will re-ignite when the dud is picked up, going off with a very short fuse!

shovel.name: Shovel
shovel.description: A shovel for digging up stuff

smoke-grenade.name: 40mm Rook Handgranaat
smoke-grenade.description:
The Smoke Grenade is a non-lethal canister-type grenade with many useful purposes. It creates a large cloud of thick grayish smoke that cannot be seen through. It can be used in various environments to cover you from enemy vision, forcing them to either shoot or reposition.
Best used in urban or wooded areas, where the flat surface will let it create the smoke screen.

It can be acquired from Outpost vending machines and crafted.

spray-can.name: Spuitkannetjie
spray-can.description: Use the Spray Can to leave Tags or reskin your items. Press [attack] to spray and [attack2] to reskin items.

stone-hatchet.name: Klip Gemaakte Byl
stone-hatchet.description: The Stone Hatchet is a primitive, early game tool used for collecting wood and flesh. It is available to craft, costing only wood and stones. Players starting out may find great use of the Stone Hatchet along with the Stone Pickaxe to aid in their farming endeavors. Although it is much less efficient than the Hatchet or Salvaged Axe, it is still used commonly due to its low barrier of entry- not costing any processed materials which require a furnace.

stone-pickaxe.name: Klip Pik
stone-pickaxe.description: Primitive tool used for harvesting Stone, Metal ore and Sulfur ore. Can also be used to harvest animals due to its relatively high harvest rate, and contrary to popular belief, it is more efficient than the stone hatchet.

supply-signal.name: Voorraadsein
supply-signal.description:
A purple smoke grenade that calls in an airdrop somewhere in a small radius around it. Can be found as a rare drop in Military and Elite Crates.

When you use this item, it will release a plume of purple smoke that can let players who are far away know that there may be individuals who just called in an airdrop. A Cargo Plane will spawn somewhere in the sky and will release the payload to your location shortly.

Calling for an airdrop to your base, especially one with high walls or a nearby monument (water pump stations, oilrig) is a fair choice. It may deter other players from looting the payload or, if you're feeling 'spicy', may bring the pvp to your front door.

survey-charge.name: Opnameheffing
survey-charge.description:
A survey charge is a small explosive that is used to determine the mineral content of an area of ground. The survey charge is placed on the ground where it explodes and throws an amount of resources into the air. The resources thrown are directly proportional to the yield of a mining quarry when placed over the crater left by the survey charge. The impact crater can also be examined manually which will generate a note containing the numerical analysis of the minerals present.
The survey charge also deals damage in an area of affect upon explosion. While ineffective against players due to the fuse and low damage, it can be used to help raid sheet metal doors if they are available, and provide enough damage to not be worth recycling instead.

timed-explosive-charge.name: Tydsberekende Plofstofpakkie
timed-explosive-charge.description:
The Timed Explosive Charge, mostly knowns as C4, is an item often used when raiding other players. Once thrown, the charge will stick to walls, floors, doors and deployable items.

Once attached to a target, the timed explosives will automatically detonate in a dependable and quick manner (in comparison to it's unreliable counterpart, the Satchel Charge). However, it does damage only to the structure it's attached to. If attached to a door, for example, it would destroy it without damaging the door frame or nearby walls.

This item deals the most damage out of all explosive devices, and is the most ideal/useful for evicting your neighbors. It's important to protect this item from your enemies, as it can prove fatal once it's in the wrong hands.

torch.name: Fakkel
torch.description:
The torch is one of two items that the player spawns into the world with, and though it finds occasional use in navigating through the dim of night and absolute darkness of the underground, it's abilities beyond that are questionable.

It is considered unwise to employ the torch in darkness unless absolutely necessary, as you mark yourself a target to any players within eyeshot.

water-bucket.name: Water Emmer
water-bucket.description: The water bucket is a useful motive for transporting liquid, however if it is stowed in the inventory, all of the contents will be emptied.

anti-radiation-pills.name: Anti-Radiasie Pille
anti-radiation-pills.description:
Anti-Rad pills are used to remove radiation. Use them after you get radiation sickness not before you go into a radiation zone. Anti-Radiation pills can also be traded at the Bandit Camp for scrap.

Beware that radiation pills cause significant dehydration.

bandage.name: Verband
bandage.description:
Bandages are crafted medical supplies that stop bleeding and heal a small amount of health.

It is common to chain-use bandages when the player has no access to other medical supplies, as hemp can be picked while running around the map and used for an easy health boost.

blood.name: Bloed
blood.description: Blood is currently not used as a component in any item in Rust, and will not drop normally. It was formerly used to craft medical supplies. It may be re-implemented at a future time.

large-medkit.name: 'N Groot medkit
large-medkit.description:
The Large Medkit is medical supplies that stops bleeding when used, provides 10 instant health and heals to max health overtime. You can use the Large Medkit by pressing it on your Inventory and click the Use button or move it to your toolbar and press the slot key to use. It does not have an Use animation so bleeding can be stopped immediately.

As of July 2021, the Large Medkit can revive you with a chance of 100% while in Wounded state, it must be placed in your toolbar to be consumed. Your revival chance also depends on your Hunger and Hydration status, if both are full, they will give a total of 40% chance to revive you.

medical-syringe.name: Mediese Inspuiting
medical-syringe.description:
The Medical Syringe is the best medical supply used for combat situations. It instant heals you a portion of your health and slowly heals the rest. It also reduces your radiation poisoning which is very useful while navigating the red puzzle building with high levels of radiation.

As of July 2021, the Medical Syringe can be used to revive people in Wounded state. It revives faster than holding E on the wounded player, however this gives you a disadvantage to look around and spot enemies as you will cancel the heal animation.

adv.-anti-rad-tea.description: A tea that reduces the amount of health lost due to radiation.

advanced-healing-tea.description: A tea that restores health over time.

advanced-max-health-tea.description: A tea that increases your maximum health.

advanced-ore-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of ore you receive.

advanced-rad.-removal-tea.description: A tea that removes some radiation.

advanced-scrap-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of scrap you receive from barrels.

advanced-wood-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of wood you receive from trees.

anchovy.description: A small bony fish commonly found in large schools.

anti-rad-tea.description: A tea that reduces the amount of health lost due to radiation.

apple.name: Appel
apple.description: The apple is a food that gives the player food and water. Unlike most other foods the apple gives lots more hydration when consumed. Can be found in food crates and medical crates.

basic-healing-tea.description: A tea that restores health over time.

basic-max-health-tea.description: A tea that increases your maximum health.

basic-ore-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of ore you receive.

basic-scrap-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of scrap you receive from barrels.

basic-wood-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of wood you receive from trees.

black-berry-clone.name: Swartbessie kloon
black-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a Black Berry Plant.

black-berry-seed.name: Black Berry Saad
black-berry-seed.description:
These black berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.

black-raspberries.name: Moerbeie
black-raspberries.description: Black Raspberries provide a large amount of health and hydration when compared to other foods, but they can only be found in monuments in food crates (not to be confused with ration boxes) making them hard to come by.

blue-berry.name: Bloubessie
blue-berry.description: A blue berry. Can be eaten or used in mixing table recipes to create teas.

blue-berry-clone.name: Blue Berry Clone
blue-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a Blue Berry Plant.

blue-berry-seed.name: Bloubessie-saad
blue-berry-seed.description:
These blue berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.

blueberries.name: Bloubessies
blueberries.description: A rare food item acquired from food crates (not to be confused with ration boxes) found in monuments randomly. They restore one 1/10th of your health and give a balanced amount hydration and calories. Just like the black raspberries, they are best to be used during combat, additionally as supplements to a medical syringe to greatly improve the healing received.

burnt-bear-meat.name: Verbrande Beer Vleis
burnt-bear-meat.description: Burnt Bear Meat is the product of overcooking Bear Meat inside of a Campfire or a Barbecue. Consuming the meat will slightly increase your health and hunger.

burnt-chicken.name: Verbrande Hoender
burnt-chicken.description: Burnt Chicken is obtained by overcooking Raw Chicken Breast. It is still edible without being harmed.

burnt-deer-meat.name: Verbrande takbokvleis
burnt-deer-meat.description: Burned Deer Meat Eating it will damage your health.

burnt-horse-meat.name: Gebrande Mensvleis
burnt-horse-meat.description: Burned horse. Eating it will damage your health.

burnt-human-meat.name: Gebrande Mensvleis
burnt-human-meat.description: Burnt Human Meat is made by overcooking Human Meat. It is not recommended to eat due to the high cost in hydration for a negligible boost to hunger. Should be thrown away unless the player is extremely desperate for food, and has access to a large/infinite amount of water.

burnt-pork.name: Verbrande Vark Vleis
burnt-pork.description: This little piggy has been in the oven for too long.

burnt-wolf-meat.name: Gebrande wolfvleis
burnt-wolf-meat.description: Burned Wolf Meat is the product of overcooking meat in a camp fire. Consuming it will damage your health, as with all other burnt meats.

cactus-flesh.description: Cactus flesh can be harvested from Cacti with an axe or rock. They provide little food value, however they give much needed hydration in the desert.

can-of-beans.name: Blik boontjies
can-of-beans.description: Beans found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

can-of-tuna.name: Blikkie tuna
can-of-tuna.description: Chunked tuna found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

candy-cane.name: Lekker Staaf
candy-cane.description: The Candy Cane is a festive item, it can be obtained only from food crates during a Christmas event. While uncommon, when found the Candy Cane is a great food source as two will fully fill the hunger bar.

catfish.description: A large, whiskered fresh water based predator. Eats everything, so you never know what you'll find in it's stomach.

chocolate-bar.name: Sjokolate staf
chocolate-bar.description: Chocolate Bar found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-bear-meat.name: Gaar Beer Vleis
cooked-bear-meat.description: Delicious Bear Meat, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-chicken.name: Gaar Hoender
cooked-chicken.description: Cooked chicken is obtained by cooking Raw Chicken Breast. You can eat it to restore hunger and a little bit of hydration.

cooked-deer-meat.name: Gekookte hertvleis
cooked-deer-meat.description: Cooked Deer Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-fish.name: Gaar Vis
cooked-fish.description: Cooked Fish. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-horse-meat.name: Gebraaide wolfsvleis
cooked-horse-meat.description: Cooked Horse Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-human-meat.name: Gaar Mensvleis
cooked-human-meat.description: Cooked Human Meat is gathered by cooking Raw Human Meat. Eating it results in gain of calories but as a disadvantage loss of hydration. It is recommended to only eat it if you have a good water source.

cooked-pork.name: Gaar Vark Vleis
cooked-pork.description: Cooked pork, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.

cooked-wolf-meat.name: Gebraaide wolfsvleis
cooked-wolf-meat.description: Cooked Wolf Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.

corn.name: Mielies
corn.description: An ear of corn. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst. Can be found at rivers and sold at Bandit Camp for 10 scrap per 15 corns.

corn-clone.name: Koring Kloon
corn-clone.description: A Clipping of a Corn Plant.

corn-seed.name: Mielie saad
corn-seed.description:
Corn seeds can be found when picking wild Corn plants. These seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.

Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more Corn and faster growth.

granola-bar.name: Gedroogde Bar
granola-bar.description: Granola Bar found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

green-berry.name: Groen Bessie
green-berry.description: A green berry. Can be eaten or used in mixing table recipes to create teas.

green-berry-clone.name: Groenbessie kloon
green-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a Green Berry Plant.

green-berry-seed.name: Groen bessiesaad
green-berry-seed.description:
These green berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more Corn and faster groth.

grub.name: Grub
grub.description: A pale, fleshy insect that can be used for bait. Could also be eaten in desperate situations.

hemp-clone.name: Hennep Kloon
hemp-clone.description: A clipping of a hemp plant.

hemp-seed.name: Hennep Saad
hemp-seed.description:
Hemp seeds are a secondary product when collecting hemp plants. These seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional cloth. A common practice is to plant them immediately after harvesting out in the world so that other new players can get cloth from it later on.

If they are planted in the ground, watering them has no effect, and you are not able to use fertilizer on them. This means that they are lower maintenance, but you have no control over the quality of the soil, so they will typically grow more slowly.

However, if you plant them in a planter box (small or large), they will require you to regularly water them and keep them stocked with fertilizer for maximum growth efficiency. Be careful not to over-water them, or efficiency may go back down a bit. Generally a good amount of water to have is somewhere between 50% and 70% capacity.

The plant needs light to grow, whether from a lamp or the sun. As of May 2020, floor grates do not let light through to the plant, despite looking like they do. This is likely a bug and may be fixed in the future. With the new electric water pump and electric water purifier, it is a good idea to build either on the beach or on a river (with one lower or missing foundation for safe access to water), as you can set up automatic plant watering fairly easily.

herring.description: A small fish commonly found in a variety of water sources.

minnows.description: Small fish caught by fish trap

mushroom.name: Sampioen
mushroom.description: Mushrooms can be found in forest and snow biomes and offer some decent healing properties. Although when eaten they don't provide many calories, they can be found in abundance in brown areas viable in the in-game map. Mushrooms will restore a portion of the consumer's health instantly, making them useful for early-game PvP.

orange-roughy.description: A rare fish found in the depths of the ocean. Eats everything, so you never know what you'll find in it's stomach.

pickles.name: Pickles
pickles.description: Pickles are edible food. However, you have a chance of getting your hunger and hydration decreased (you'll hear a vomit sound). It is recommended you save up pickles to feed horses, use as a bait for fish traps or compost for fertilizers.

potato-clone.name: Aartappelkloon
potato-clone.description: A Clipping of a Potato Plant.

potato-seed.name: Aartappelsaad
potato-seed.description:
These potato seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more potatoes and faster growth.

pumpkin.name: Pampoen
pumpkin.description:
The Pumpkin provides a great amount of calories, hydration, and healing compared to the other foods. It can also be worn on your head. When high durability, seeds are dropped when consumed. With the plant giving 3 harvests, they prove to be an easy to farm foodstuff giving massive returns.

Can be found on the sides of streams.

pumpkin-plant-clone.name: Pampoenplant kloon
pumpkin-plant-clone.description:
A Clipping of a pumpkin plant.
Pumpkin Clones/Cuttings are collected by holding -E- on a 65% grown pumpkin plant

pumpkin-seed.name: Pampoensaad
pumpkin-seed.description: When planted, the pumpkin plant gives 3 harvests before being unusable. With this, it makes it easy to farm and mass produce, with farms growing exponentially through gameplay.

pure-anti-rad-tea.description: A tea that reduces the amount of health lost due to radiation.

pure-healing-tea.description: A tea that restores health over time.

pure-max-health-tea.description: A tea that increases your maximum health.

pure-ore-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of ore you receive.

pure-rad.-removal-tea.description: A tea that removes some radiation.

pure-scrap-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of scrap you receive from barrels.

pure-wood-tea.description: A tea that increases the amount of wood you receive from trees.

rad.-removal-tea.description: A tea that removes some radiation.

raw-bear-meat.name: Rou Beervleis
raw-bear-meat.description: Raw Bear Meat. Eating it will damage your health, try cooking it first.

raw-chicken-breast.name: Rou hoenderborsie
raw-chicken-breast.description: Raw Chicken Breast is obtained by killing and harvesting a chicken. It is recommended to cook before eating.

raw-deer-meat.name: Rou hertvleis
raw-deer-meat.description: Raw Deer Meat. Eating it will damage your health, try cooking it first.

raw-horse-meat.name: Rou perdevleis
raw-horse-meat.description: Raw Horse Meat. Eating it will damage your health, try cooking it first.

raw-human-meat.name: Rou Mensvleis
raw-human-meat.description: Raw Human Meat is gathered by hitting a dead body with a weapon. it is not recommended to eat unless you cook it in a campfire first.

raw-pork.description: Raw pork. Eating it will damage your health, try cooking it first.

raw-wolf-meat.name: Rou wolfsvleis
raw-wolf-meat.description: Raw Wolf Meat. Eating it will damage your health, try cooking it first.

red-berry.name: Rooi Bessie
red-berry.description: a red berry, used in the making of various types of tea.

red-berry-clone.name: Rooibessie Steggie
red-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a Red Berry Plant.

red-berry-seed.name: Rooi bessiesaad
red-berry-seed.description:
These red berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.

rotten-apple.name: Vrot Appel
rotten-apple.description: A rotten apple. Eating it currently provides a tiny boost to health, hunger, and thirst.

salmon.description: A large Salmon, found in fresh and salt water. Eats everything, so you never know what you'll find in it's stomach.

sardine.description: A small oily fish, commonly found in large schools.

small-shark.description: A small, surprisingly aggressive deep sea predator. Eats everything, so you never know what you'll find in it's stomach.

small-trout.description: A fish, edible after being gutted and cooked. Obtainable by putting large bait in a fish trap.

small-water-bottle.name: Klein waterbottel
small-water-bottle.description:
The Water Bottle found in trash piles, and is used for the collection and transportation of drinkable water.

To fill, equip it and right click while looking at a source of water. You can then drink from it whenever you desire with a left click (make sure the water in the bottle is freshwater and not salt/stagnant water).

If the water in the pouch is not desired, or if you are attempting to extinguish a fire (not napalm), you can right click on the bottle again to dump it's contents.

spoiled-chicken.name: Vrot Hoender
spoiled-chicken.description: Spoiled Chicken. Eating it will damage your health.

spoiled-human-meat.name: Bedorwe Mensvleis
spoiled-human-meat.description: Spoiled Human Meat. Consuming will damage your health.

spoiled-wolf-meat.name: Verrotte wolfsvleis
spoiled-wolf-meat.description: Spoiled Wolf Meat. Consuming will damage your health.

super-serum.name: Super Serum
super-serum.description: Super Serum, more ore, more wood, more scrap

water-jug.name: Water Jug
water-jug.description:
The water jug is an item which carries water and can be held in the players hot-bar or inventory.

The water jug is far superior to the water bucket because of its extra 1,000 ml capacity and its ability to hold water while not in the hands of the user. It is most commonly used in large numbers to carry massive amounts of water to a players base in one trip. It is highly recommended that you have multiple of these items if you plan to have any kind of indoor farm because of the water bonus to farming.

white-berry.name: Wit bessie
white-berry.description: A white berry. Can be eaten or used in mixing table recipes to create teas.

white-berry-clone.name: Witbessie Steggie
white-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a White Berry Plant.

white-berry-seed.name: Witbessiesaad
white-berry-seed.description:
These white berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.

worm.name: Wurm
worm.description: A small, writhing worm that can be used for bait. Could also be eaten in desperate situations.

yellow-berry.name: Geelbessie
yellow-berry.description: A yellow berry. Can be eaten or used in mixing table recipes to create teas.

yellow-berry-clone.name: Geelbessie Steggie
yellow-berry-clone.description: A clipping of a Yellow Berry Plant.

yellow-berry-seed.name: Geelbessiesaad
yellow-berry-seed.description:
These yellow berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food.


Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.

yellow-perch.description: A Yellow Perch, commonly found in freshwater rivers.

12-gauge-buckshot.name: 12 Boor-dikte Bokskoot Koeël
12-gauge-buckshot.description:
12 Gauge Buckshot is a type shotgun ammunition that fires a wide spread of 14 low-damage pellets. Regardless of the weapon it is fired out of, it is extremely lethal in close quarters, capable of one-shotting fully geared players at point-blank.

12 Gauge buckshot has fewer pellets than the Handmade Shell, but makes up for it by doing much more damage with each pellet.

12-gauge-incendiary-shell.name: 12 Gauge Incendiary Shell
12-gauge-incendiary-shell.description: The 12 gauge incendiary shell is a new shotgun ammunition as of Devblog 198. Once fired, unlike any other shell, it will spew out flaming shotgun projectiles. If stepped on, the player that walks over it will take fire damage. The flame projectile sparks rather than flame when the projectile hit the target.

12-gauge-slug.name: 12 Boor-dikte Koeël
12-gauge-slug.description: 12 Gauge Slug is a type of shotgun ammunition that fires a single, high-damage projectile. 12 Gauge Slug is most useful for when the user seeks to significantly extend the range of their shotgun at the cost of decreased lethality in close-quarters and requiring more precise aim to land a hit.

40mm-shotgun-round.description: The 40mm shotgun round is an ammunition type for the Multiple Grenade Launcher. It fires a wide spread of 12 pellets that can do a massive amount of damage at close range, being able to one-shot a fully geared player if all pellets connect.

40mm-smoke-grenade.description: Ammunition for a 40mm Grenade Launcher. Produces a cloud of smoke when fired.

5.56-rifle-ammo.name: 5.56 Geweerammunisie
5.56-rifle-ammo.description: Standard high powered ammunition, used by any rifle in the game currently. Offers superior damage, range, accuracy, damage drop off and air resistance from the Pistol Bullet.

bone-arrow.description: A slower, less damaging arrow that is easier to hit people with.

explosive-5.56-rifle-ammo.name: Plofbare 5.56 Roer Ammunisie
explosive-5.56-rifle-ammo.description:
A variant of the standard 5.56 rifle ammunition. The Explosive 5.56 round deals a small amount of additional explosion damage to a player upon direct impact as well as damaging nearby structures or players.

The round is effective against low-tier structures such as Wood walls and Sheet Metal doors.

fire-arrow.name: Vuurpyl
fire-arrow.description:
Low-velocity high-damage equivalent to the wooden arrows. Emits a fiery area of effect near its point of impact which will damage and slow anyone in its radius. In combat this can deny both a push and a retreat.

As a raid tool it's faster and quieter than the eoka. Unlike the flamethrower, the fire it spreads won't damage structures.

hv-5.56-rifle-ammo.name: HS 5.56 Geweerammunisie
hv-5.56-rifle-ammo.description: A variant of the standard 5.56 rifle ammunition. The High Velocity (HV) 5.56 round will travel faster than the standard round at a more expensive crafting cost. The round experiences little bullet drop. This type of ammo is best used with Bolt Action Rifle and L96 Rifle.

hv-pistol-ammo.name: HS pistoolammunisie
hv-pistol-ammo.description:
The high velocity pistol ammo is used by pistols and submachine guns.

Its notable differences from regular pistol ammo include faster bullet travel and increased crafting cost.

handmade-shell.name: Handgemaakte Koeël
handmade-shell.description:
The handmade shell is an early-game shotgun ammunition that fires a spread of 20 low-damage pellets. It's highly damaging in close quarters, but its lethality quickly drops off as range increases.

In comparison to 12 gauge buckshot, the handmade shell has significantly more pellets, but less damage overall.

high-velocity-arrow.name: Hoë Snelheid vuurpyl
high-velocity-arrow.description: The high velocity arrow is one of four ammo types for the crossbow, compound bow, and the bow. It can be shot further and faster than the normal arrow, however, it causes less damage.

high-velocity-rocket.name: Hoë-snelheid vuurpyl
high-velocity-rocket.description: The High-Velocity Rocket trades damage for a much higher speed and far less drop. The High-Velocity rocket is best used against placeables (mainly turrets), vehicles such as cars and helicopters, and enemy players. It is essentially intended for cases where a rocket would be overkill, or you would need the extra speed. The high-velocity rocket has poor damage against buildables and doors, but is a valuable tool for raiding in the other ways described.

homing-missile.name: Homing Missiel
homing-missile.description: Fast moving rocket ammunition. Uses a type of radar for active target guidance from a Homing Launcher

incendiary-5.56-rifle-ammo.name: Brandstigtende 5.56 Roer Ammunisie
incendiary-5.56-rifle-ammo.description: A variant of the standard 5.56 rifle ammunition. The 5.56 Incendiary round will ignite on impact dealing both bullet and fire damage to a player. The round is however subject to increased bullet drop and lower velocity. This bullet is an especially effective counter to helicopters and vehicles for its cost.

incendiary-pistol-bullet.name: Brandstigtende Pistool Koeël
incendiary-pistol-bullet.description: Slower, slightly more effective pistol bullet that also deals fire damage. Useful against Heavy Plate armor.

incendiary-rocket.name: Brandstigtende Vuurpyl
incendiary-rocket.description: Incendiary rockets spread flames over the area of impact, dealing fire damage to its surroundings. It deals heavy damage to wooden structures and turrets. They can also be used effectively to trap and kill players in an enclosed space.

mlrs-rocket.name: MLRS vuurpyl
mlrs-rocket.description: The MLRS Rocket is a projectile for the MLRS, they are found in Locked Crates as well as the MLRS Aiming Module. It has lethal damage to both structures and players. 3 SAM Sites can easily destroy the projectiles.

nailgun-nails.name: Spyker Nagels
nailgun-nails.description: Early game cheap and easy to acquire ammo for the Nailgun. Has a unique trajectory and velocity that is worse than regular arrows shot from a Hunting Bow, thus giving it a really small effective range. Work best up close and not beyond 10 meters.

pistol-bullet.name: Pistool Koeël
pistol-bullet.description: Standard ammunition for pistols and submachine guns.

rocket.name: Vuurpyl
rocket.description:
In Rust, rockets are the ammunition for rocket launchers, rockets will cause splash damage that can hit up to 4 walls at once. This type of ammunition is particularly effective against buildings.

In terms of trajectory, rockets are launched forward with a considerable speed upon firing. However, the trajectory eventually falls off due to the in-game gravity effect.

Rockets are currently one of the best tools for raiding and destroying buildings. Rockets are also deadly against players due to its high damage and range of splash damage.

sam-ammo.name: SAM Ammo
sam-ammo.description: Ammunition for a Sam Site, This missile contains a rudimentary guidance system to help it navigate through strong winds.

smoke-rocket-wip!!!!.name: Rook vuurpyl WIP!!!!
smoke-rocket-wip!!!!.description: Currently, smoke rockets in Rust are labeled as WIP (Work In Progress). They do minor poison damage to players or to structures, and provide minimal amounts of quickly disappearing smoke. Though they are cannot currently be crafted or found, admins are able to spawn them in via the console.

torpedo.name: Torpedo
torpedo.description:
Ammunition for both submarine types. Fires in a straight line. Used to be called Direct Torpedo.

As of September 2021's update, the Surface Torpedo was removed from the game due to players camping underwater with little to no risk. The Direct Torpedo was then renamed to Torpedo.

wooden-arrow.name: Hout pyl
wooden-arrow.description: The Wooden Arrow is one of four ammo types for the crossbow and the bow. It has lower range and velocity than the High Velocity Arrow, but it does more damage compared to it.

flame-turret.name: Vlam Rewolwer
flame-turret.description:
The flame turret is a unique item that is difficult to find many applications for. It mostly finds it's way into 'trap bases', where a player is locked in a tight space and is burnt to a crisp by this monster.

It functions similarly to an Auto-Turret, activating only when a player without building privilege wanders in front of it. It then rotates rapidly, spewing a wall of flame in about a 30° angle in the general direction of the target until the target is dead or gone.

The flame turret is fueled by low grade fuel, and has a relatively short range to it's flames. Thus, this is a trap that requires a fair bit of planning for you to make good use of, but can be a powerful ally if you do.

homemade-landmine.name: Tuisgemaakte landmyn
homemade-landmine.description: A small explosive device which activates when a player steps off the pressure plate. The land mine can be deactivated by a friend by hold 'Use' button (default 'E') on it so that the player can step off safely.

sam-site.name: SAM werf
sam-site.description:
The SAM Site targets any air vehicles (minicopter, scrap helicopter and hot air balloon, even TC authorized players with air vehicles) in range and shoots SAM ammo at the targeted vehicle. They will also target at MLRS rockets, 3 SAM sites are recommended for maximum MLRS protection.

It is recommended to have a RF Transmitter or a Smart Switch paired on your phone to toggle the SAM site if you have air vehicles.

As of February 2022, the SAM site has a Defender Mode that only targets MLRS rockets but not air vehicles. This allows you to still use your minicopters, but never friendly fired by your own SAM sites.

shotgun-trap.description: An entry-level turret crafted from easy to acquire components and resources. Activated by anyone within it's line of sight that does not have building privilege. Loaded with handmade shells, and can fire them independently without player intervention. Handy for protecting airlocks, or trap bases.

snap-trap.name: Klemval
snap-trap.description:
The Snap Trap is a small anti-personnel trap used to wound a player. The trap can be deactivated for safe passage by hitting/shooting the middle causing the trap to slam shut making it harmless.

They can be picked back up once triggered if you have building privilege.

tin-can-alarm.description: A primitive perimeter alarm made from hanging tin cans. Clatters loudly when disturbed, alerting you to any trespassers. Simple but effective.

wooden-floor-spikes.name: Grond houtpenne
wooden-floor-spikes.description: The Wooden floor spikes are a basic anti-personnel trap. They are placed on the ground and will slow a player that travels through them as well as inflicting damage.

blue-keycard.description:
The Blue Keycard is a game object required in order to access quite a lot of monument puzzles.
It can be obtained by fishing and gutting high tier fish or by completing green monument puzzles on Harbors, Satellite Dish or Sewer Branch.

List of monuments that require Blue Keycard to finish monument puzzle:
Airfield, Arctic Research Base, Military Tunnels, Missile Silo, Oil Rig, Power Plant, Trainyard, Water Treatment and Underwater Labs.

Large Oil Rig does not require Blue Keycard to access Locked Crate but it grants access to 4 military crates.

bronze-egg.description: A Bronze Egg. Open for a surprise or collect 10 to upgrade to a silver egg.

captain's-log.description: A deteriorating piece of paper with information relating to the last moments of this vessel.

coffin.name: Doodskis
coffin.description: An old wooden coffin, can store up to 42 items.

cursed-cauldron.name: Vervloekte Ketel
cursed-cauldron.description: A spooky cast iron cauldron with a green goo.

decorative-baubels.description: Decorative Baubels you can hang on your Christmas tree.

decorative-gingerbread-men.description: Decorative Gingerbread Men you can hang on your Christmas tree.

decorative-pinecones.description: Decorative Pinecones you can hang on your Christmas tree.

decorative-plastic-candy-canes.description: Decorative Plastic Candy Canes you can hang on your Christmas tree.

decorative-tinsel.description: Decorative Tinsel you can hang on your Christmas tree.

door-key.name: Sleutel
door-key.description:
Door keys are used in conjunction with a Key Lock for letting others access (open and close) your door.
Important: the person who places a Key Lock, has access by default, without the need for a door key.

If the key is lost, then the person carrying it won't have access anymore. In addition, if their killer or anyone else loots it from them and are able to locate the base, your base (or the particular door) might be compromised. So overall, carrying door keys outside of your base is risky.

To avoid this risk, it's advised to upgrade to Code Locks if you have multiple people that need to have access to your doors. Using keylocks within groups is really not practical, they are mostly used by solo players.

egg-basket.name: Eiermandjie
egg-basket.description: An easter egg basket. Equip to pick up eggs during an easter egg hunt with left click. Use right click to throw Painted Eggs that deal splash damage.

fogger-3000.name: Fogger-3000
fogger-3000.description: A Fog machine which runs on low grade fuel. Can be set to fill an area with a dense fog or triggered by motion.

giant-candy-decor.name: Reuse Lekkergoedversiering
giant-candy-decor.description: Get into the holiday spirit with this decorative inflated giant candy cane.

giant-lollipop-decor.description: Get into the holiday spirit with these decorative giant lollipops.

gold-egg.description: A Gold Egg. Containing the best easter loot.

gravestone.description: A Gravestone marking the remains of an unknown soul.

green-keycard.description:
The Green Keycard is a game object required in order to access a some monument puzzles.
It can be obtained by killing and looting scientists and can be found on desk in Abandoned Cabins, Abandoned Supermarket, Ferry Terminal, Junkyard, Lighthouse, Oxum's Gas Station, Underwater Lab and by completing Power Plant's monument puzzle.

List of monuments that require Green Keycard to finish monument puzzle:
Airfield, Harbors, Launch Site, Military Tunnels, Power Plant, Satellite Dish and Sewer Branch.

halloween-candy.description: Some loose halloween candy Collect 10 to upgrade to a Small Loot Bag!

head-bag.name: Head Bag
head-bag.description: A sack containing the head of a defeated foe. Can be added to trophies.

large-loot-bag.description: A massive haul. Contains the best halloween loot

large-present.description: Large Presents are a consumable, seasonal item that can only be found on the Christmas season. Upon consuming the item the player will be rewarded with high value items

medium-loot-bag.description: Contains medium level loot, Collect 10 to upgrade to a Large loot bag, containing the best loot

medium-present.description: A medium present, might be good! Collect 5 to upgrade to a larger present.

note.name: Nota
note.description:
A note which can have letters written on but not notes. When a note is done being written on the player may place it in a container or leave it in their inventory. Useful for conveying messages to other players or raiders.

Notes are the only items that may be placed inside of mailboxes, and are handy for keeping in contact with friendly neighbors.

painted-egg.description: Some simple painted eggs. Collect 10 to upgrade to a bronze egg

photograph.name: Foto
photograph.description: A photograph taken with an instant camera.

pumpkin-basket.name: Pumpkin Basket
pumpkin-basket.description: A pumpkin basket to help you collect candy much faster during Trick or Treat events with left click. Use right click to throw candy

red-keycard.description:
The Red Keycard is game object required in order to access high tier loot in monument puzzles.
It can be obtained by completing blue monument puzzles on Airfield, Arctic Research Base, Missile Silo, Powerplant, Trainyard and Water Treatment.
List of monuments that require Red Keycard to finish monument puzzle:
Large Oil Rig, Launch Site, Military Tunnels, Small Oil Rig and Underwater Lab.

rustige-egg-blue.description: A beautiful hand-crafted egg made of sapphire and white gold. It contains a miniature arrangement of the light house monument and plays a song while open.

rustige-egg-green.description: A beautiful hand crafted gold and green egg, with a miniature traincart contained inside.

rustige-egg-ivory.description: An beautiful hand-crafted egg made of ivory and gold. It contains a miniature arrangement of the satellite dish monument and plays a song while open.

rustige-egg-purple.description: A beautiful hand-crafted egg with gold lace. It contains a miniature arrangement of the oil rig monument (with circling Chinook) and plays a song while open.

rustige-egg-red.description: An exquisite hand-crafted egg made of diamond and gold. It contains a miniature arrangement of the dome monument and plays a song while open.

rustige-egg-white.description: A beautiful hand crafted gold and white egg, with a miniature underwater lab scene contained inside.

sickle.name: Sekel
sickle.description: A very sharp curved cutting weapon. While its traditional role was to cut grass, this tool is also extremely versatile at cutting throats, perhaps trees, too.

silver-egg.description: A Silver Egg. Contains medium level loot, Collect 10 to upgrade to a gold Egg

small-loot-bag.description: Open for a surprise, or collect 10 to upgrade to a medium loot bag containing better loot!

small-present.description: A small stocking stuffer present, Collect 10 to upgrade to a larger present.

snow-machine.name: Sneeimasjien
snow-machine.description: A machine which will blanket the surrounding terrain in snow.

spider-webs.description: Giant Cobwebs which can be hung against both a ceiling and a wall.

spooky-speaker.name: Spooky Speaker
spooky-speaker.description: Frighten your guests with creepy and spooky halloween sounds!

star-tree-topper.description: A golden star to top off your Christmas Tree.

strobe-light.name: Strobe lig
strobe-light.description: A flashing light, 3 speeds. Causes seizures.

tree-lights.description: A tree isn't complete without colorful lights!

wooden-cross.description: A wooden cross marking the remains of an unknown soul.

armored-cockpit-vehicle-module.name: Gepantserde kajuitvoertuigmodule
armored-cockpit-vehicle-module.description: Single module armored cockpit for a driver and one passenger.

armored-passenger-vehicle-module.name: Gepantserde passasiersvoertuigmodule
armored-passenger-vehicle-module.description: Single module armored seating for two passengers.

bleach.description: Bleach is only obtainable through the console with sufficient permissions. It currently has no use.

burst-module.name: Burst Module
burst-module.description: Forces the weapon to fire in 3 round bursts.

camper-vehicle-module.name: Kampeervoertuigmodule
camper-vehicle-module.description:
The Camper Vehicle Module is a dual module camper that can be fitted into a 3 Module Vehicle or a 4 Module Vehicle (does not come with a cockpit with engine), containing 4 sleeping bags, a barbeque, a locker and a small storage box.

By claiming a bed inside the camper, you can respawn on it and has the same respawn cooldown as the sleeping bag. The locker, barbeque and small storage box can also be used for storage, kits and more. It acts as a portable sleeping bag as you can drive it anywhere and respawn on it (except for safe zones).

cockpit-vehicle-module.name: Kajuitvoertuigmodule
cockpit-vehicle-module.description: Single module cockpit for a driver and one passenger.

cockpit-with-engine-vehicle-module.name: Kajuit met motorvoertuigmodule
cockpit-with-engine-vehicle-module.description: Single module cockpit for a driver and one passenger, with a small engine.

duct-tape.description: Duct Tape: Currently not used with any or has any use/purpose within the game at the current moment. Maybe FacePunch will give it a use at a later time.

electric-fuse.name: Sekering
electric-fuse.description: The Electric Fuse is a required item for monument puzzle rooms. It must be placed in the fuse box in order to power the keycard lock. Recycling the electric fuse also gives some quick scrap.

empty-propane-tank.description: Tank used in crafting of the flamethrower and water purifier. Also can be recycled as a decent source of metal fragments.

fuel-tank-vehicle-module.name: Brandstoftenkvoertuigmodule
fuel-tank-vehicle-module.description: Dual module large fuel tank. Useful for transporting water over large distances.

gears.description:
Gears are used in the crafting of various desirable (building) supplies involved in base defense, such as traps, gates, and first and foremost armored & garage doors, which are significantly stronger than sheet metal doors.

These are hard to come by in large quantities and are one of the more sought after items in the game.

glue.description: A sticky white substance that at this point in time has no real functions. Only players with access to the console (i.e Admin, owner, mod) can spawn it.

high-quality-carburetor.description: A high quality carburetor for a combustion engine. Mixes air and fuel to the proper ratio.

high-quality-crankshaft.description: A high quality crankshaft for a combustion engine. Converts piston movement into rotational motion.

high-quality-pistons.description: High quality pistons for a combustion engine. Pistons convert expanding combustion gases into the motion that turns a crankshaft.

high-quality-spark-plugs.description: High quality spark plugs for a combustion engine. Spark plugs ignite the fuel/air mixture to move the pistons.

high-quality-valves.description: High quality poppet valves for a combustion engine. Valves control the intake and exhaust flow.

low-quality-carburetor.description: A low quality carburetor for a combustion engine. Mixes air and fuel to the proper ratio.

low-quality-crankshaft.description: A low quality crankshaft for a combustion engine. Converts piston movement into rotational motion.

low-quality-pistons.description: Low quality pistons for a combustion engine. Pistons convert expanding combustion gases into the motion that turns a crankshaft.

low-quality-spark-plugs.description: Low quality spark plugs for a combustion engine. Spark plugs ignite the fuel/air mixture to move the pistons.

low-quality-valves.description: Low quality poppet valves for a combustion engine. Valves control the intake and exhaust flow.

mlrs-aiming-module.name: MLRS-mikmodule
mlrs-aiming-module.description: The MLRS Aiming Module is a required item to use the MLRS, it can only be found in Locked Crates considering the power of the MLRS. After using the MLRS, the aiming module gets consumed.

medium-quality-carburetor.description: A medium quality carburetor for a combustion engine. Mixes air and fuel to the proper ratio.

medium-quality-crankshaft.description: A medium quality crankshaft for a combustion engine. Converts piston movement into rotational motion.

medium-quality-pistons.description: Medium quality pistons for a combustion engine. Pistons convert expanding combustion gases into the motion that turns a crankshaft.

medium-quality-spark-plugs.description: Medium quality spark plugs for a combustion engine. Spark plugs ignite the fuel/air mixture to move the pistons.

medium-quality-valves.description: Medium quality poppet valves for a combustion engine. Valves control the intake and exhaust flow.

metal-blade.description:
Metal blades are common components that can be found in barrels near roads or at monuments. They are used to craft some tools and melee weapons.

If you don't have any use for the items you can craft with these it would be wise to recycle them for two scrap.

metal-pipe.description: Pipes are a relatively common component that are used for guns, salvaged tools, and rocket launchers and rockets. They can be somewhat abundant early game until you find the need to craft rockets, and then get consumed very quickly.

metal-spring.description: An uncommon component used for the construction of almost every gun. It may be found with moderate frequency from crates, and uncommonly from barrels. Generally speaking, guns of higher tiers will require more Metal Springs, while low tier guns (Semi Auto Pistol, Rifle) require only one.

rear-seats-vehicle-module.name: Agtersitplekke Voertuigmodule
rear-seats-vehicle-module.description: Single module seating for two passengers.

rifle-body.description: A rare component which is used for crafting late-game rifles. It can only be found in military and elite crates.

road-signs.description: Road signs are a component used in the crafting of the mid-tier armors Road Sign Jacket, and Road Sign Kilt, along with crafting the salvaged cleaver. Also good as a source of scrap throughout the game.

rope.description:
Rope is quite common component used in many items like wooden armor, satchel charges, ladders and shotgun traps. Because of that it remains relatively useful throughout the whole game.

It can be often found in barrels alongside sewing kits which can be recycled for even more rope.

smg-body.description: A rare component which is used for crafting submachine guns. It can only be found in military and elite crates.

semi-automatic-body.description: Semi Automatic Bodies are components used in the crafting of Semi-Auto Pistols and Semi-Auto Rifles. They can be found quite commonly and can be recycled for a good profit.

sewing-kit.description: Sewing Kits are highly valued by mid to high tier players for their use in both roadsign and metal Armour.

sheet-metal.description: An uncommon component that can be recycled into Metal Fragments and High Quality Metal, or used in the crafting of Heavy Plate armor pieces. It can be found in crates and barrels.

sticks.description: Sticks is an item that currently serves no purpose in the game.

tarp.description: Tarps are used for the crafting of planter boxes, and water catchers. They can also be recycled for 50x cloth each. These are very common and can prove to be a good source of cloth.

taxi-vehicle-module.name: Taxi Voertuig Module
taxi-vehicle-module.description: Single module seating for two passengers, with a window and a shop front at the front.

tech-trash.description: Tech Trash is an essential component in Timed Explosive Charges and weapon attachments. Tech Trash can be gained via military crates or the recycler.

and-switch.description: A logic gate that allows eletrical passthrough if BOTH inputs receives power, passthrough amount is the greater of either power source.

audio-alarm.description: A speaker which will emit a loud warning alarm when powered.

auto-turret.name: Automatiese Geweer
auto-turret.description:
The Auto Turret is a placed object used to detect enemies and shoot with its armed weapon. It detects enemies if the enemies were to reach its 180 degrees detection range or shoot the turret. The Auto Turret ignores the Tool Cupboard authorizations and only shoot people not in its authorize list so you and your team must authorize to it manually.

You can arm any ranged weapons onto the Auto Turret and insert the ammo of the equipped weapon. You must turn the turret off in order to refill ammo and weapon slot.

The Auto Turret can be turned on if the Power In slot is powering at least 10 rWm. There are 3 extra slots (Has Target, Low Ammo, No Ammo) that you can set up with Smart Alarm or traps, you must have 11 rWm for the Auto Turret to power the 3 slots. As an example, if someone walks into the detection range of the Auto Turret, 1 rWm will be used up to power out the Has Target slot.

The Auto Turret has 2 modes, Peacekeeper and Attack All. By default, Attack All mode makes the turret targets unauthorized players. Peacekeeper mode only shoots hostile players that has the red sight icon on the top right corner, it works just like the Outpost turrets and Bandit Camp turrets.

blocker.description: This object prevents passthrough while power is received through its second input.

button.name: Knoppie
button.description: If pressed on, Output sends power for a few seconds and deactivates itself. Works like a timer with no ability to change the time.

cable-tunnel.description: Allows you to pass a cable through a wall. Each input will forward the amount it receives to the corresponding output on the other side.

ceiling-light.name: Dak lig
ceiling-light.description: A small ceiling mounted light source. It speeds up plants in a planter growth by 2x.

computer-station.description: The Computer Station can be used for real-time surveillance by pairing with any available CCTV Cameras. There are specific monuments with indestructible CCTV Cameras, the IDs are static and cannot be changed.

counter.description: A basic cathode ray tube screen combined with an incremental counter. Can display power received, or can count upwards and allow passthrough when a target is reached.

deluxe-christmas-lights.description: Colored, Animated, Powered Lights. Requires 5 electricity. Click to start placement, right click to end. Each unit is 0.5m long.

digital-clock.description: A digital clock that displays the server time and lets you set alarms to pass power through when ringing. Ideal for synchronizing traps or timed events.

door-controller.description: A Door Controller. Will manipulate the state of the closest door when it recieves power.

electric-furnace.name: Elektriese smee-oond
